timeline.bodyText:
Suggest a bullet list:

RUNNING: the query was either started recently or has been running without errors.
ERROR: the query has entered an error state.
UNRESPONSIVE: the host running the query returned an error when the query status was requested.
timeline.author: JimGalasyn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -23,6 +23,15 @@ Description
 
 `SHOW QUERIES EXTENDED` lists queries running in the cluster in more detail.
 
+Query Status
+-----------
+
+`RUNNING`: the query was either just started, or has been running without errors.
+
+`ERROR`: the query has entered an error state.
+
+`UNRESPONSIVE`: the host running the query returned an error when requesting the query status.
+

timeline.bodyText:
KsqlQueryState makes it sounds like its referring to a state store or underlying state.. May be KsqlQueryStatus is a better name?
Just a thought. Leave it to you :)
timeline.author: vinothchandar

replies.bodyText:
hmm, I see what you mean and I agree. I used state here because we previously had getState for the QueryMetadata object so I just continued using State in the recent changes I made and this current one.
I'm not sure exactly what we want to be calling this, should we just make the change in this PR to try to use status wherever we can instead of state?
replies.author: stevenpyzhang

replies.bodyText:
@vinothchandar I think I'm leaning more on the side of just keeping it state for now since I'm keeping the state field in the RunningQuery and QueryDescription response objects for backwards compatibility.
Any thoughts @rodesai ? The upcoming query error handling would be using this enum.
replies.author: stevenpyzhang

replies.bodyText: I vote for status to disambiguate from queryable state.
replies.author: rodesai

replies.bodyText: error and status go more hand in hand IMO.. I do see this is "Streams' state" per se. leave it to you :)

replies.bodyText: I've changed it to KsqlQueryStatus now

timeline.bodyText:
It would be better if CompletableFuture was used here instead of the legacy blocking Future class.
That way we wouldn't have to refactor this code when we move to a non blocking model.
This is a general point really, we shouldn't be using Future in new code.
